title: Anchor Standards: Grades K-5
subject: College and Career Ready Standards for Literacy (CCRSL) (2017-)

document.title: DoDEA College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards

4D24BDFB2E5E4D458C1774938C2B7DDE.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

3055FB29DFC44B00845D7D141CEC6BB4.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

00A661C8B8094C9998993424143D898E.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

4BF4561CB9C9492BB0E4A5C0C8473098.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

149E099F992C4A70BD6173F41443AD1B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

EA0E5305B3824C3AA2D539AE64158BF5.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

D2F0A627C8A945AD918EA00C7295E2A3.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

438DE179E5254D15BA5279B59C478ECD.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

ECB1CC6FB9894ACEB0C86D454A142150.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

AFBF1F6241224865B7DECA8E8C8A32E1.description: Speaking and Listening: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

565452C37BB642119A957AD6A9A1AD5B.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

FF76BA2D3CC247D0AD449C9E88F43EB5.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

C9DAC266B3004B0DBA141670A42B2F8A.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

9E2F9EE4AF01484F9BCE3A2B5BF71FEA.description: Speaking and Listening: Comprehension and Collaboration

2B90E532658647DFB2867F5AECC5CFE2.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

248BEDBCE761422FB58EAE3474D227CC.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C6D76D27BACE4C8AB474B9C409DE8B62.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

55457C899CD44C65975CB4D56E1CC494.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

0177CF40410A456A9764DF333F358979.description: Writing: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

A64DFC692D264A229CAB6CBC1327CA7B.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

FA85DF711BCE4230ABD17CA99219F2A2.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

3C20A863C5084A45909EB6169002058C.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

86DA119290774AF5BCBDDF7DEA4AD1F1.description: Writing: Production and Distribution of Writing

F3F421ECB24E425498C2F1EBE40768EC.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

6DBA527BD1584EC6A5883CAD9D291C05.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

B7F05380CE3C4D72A0F433C6DDD15721.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

16F461C12BC2498BB5C56C487D8DF6F3.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

CDD05FC3E9274F99948ACFF9D484DD4C.description: Reading: Range of Reading  and Level of Text Complexity

9F52EF8E1BBE4BA49D1E1D85649485D2.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

8DCF053CA24A4DFF95628C6D1B26580F.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

A1C45A3261FE4F5E8D1BB4329D7406E8.description: *Please see “Research to Build Knowledge” in Writing and “Comprehension and Collaboration” in Speaking and Listening for additional standards relevant to gathering, assessing, and applying information from print and digital sources.

D1484D0334AC4A839CD21FAF8B9D52D3.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse formats and media, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.*

6D8D51120F57402E82B9D6D61CAC6B56.description: Reading: Integration of knowledge and Ideas

FC3A2F9020F24E41B4F72686DD99E1D7.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

0A282F03E0D844EF8B7A3A1BEFD27514.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

E58300DF687B4360BE742C870849F7B2.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

5680EDB307C64FD08E283A47646CF3FD.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

A70484FAE581493FBEE6CDF42A599990.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

B0068AC06A22419FAB6E7AF397615163.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
